newsitem.title: USA: CSCE March world sugar ends at 10-week high.
newsitem.headline: CSCE March world sugar ends at 10-week high.

text.p: CSCE world sugar futures settled at a 10-week high on technically-driven, mixed buying, market sources said.

Early trade buying carried the most-active March contract through key-psychological resistance at 11.00 cents. The move over resistance triggered buying by the locals, who were probing for stops at 11.05.
Once the contract pierced firmer resistance at 11.05 cents, fund buying emerged and carried the contract to the day's high of 11.12 cents in March.
"It is a very bullish close," a broker said. The contract closed at 11.27 on Sept 23.
Dealers said steady trade scale-up selling limited gains.
The most-active March contract rose 0.14 cent on the day to 11.08, traded 11.12 to 10.92. The back months finished 0.13 to 0.02 higher.
Volume was estimated at a hefty 27,114 lots.
Near-term support was pegged at 11.02 and 10.98 cents in March.
